“Even the smallest person can change the course of the future.” —

“Nothing is too high for a man to reach, but he must climb with care and confidence” —

“They say love is the best investment; the more you give, the more you get in return.” —
Audrey Hepburn

“Take the attitude of a student. Never be too big to ask questions. Never know too much to learn something new.” —
Og Mandino

“You may be one person in this world, but to one person you may mean the world.” —
Unknown

“Do not ignore the passion that burns in you. Spend time to discover your gift.” —
Steve Harvey

“The past is history. It no longer exists, but you are keeping it alive in your mind through your thoughts. Let it go. It is not serving you.” —
Sonia Ricotti

“Sometimes you will never know the value of something, until it becomes a memory.” —
Dr. Seuss

“Never argue with stupid people, they will drag you down to their level and then beat you with experience.” —
Mark Twain

“The scariest monsters are the ones that lurk within our souls.” —
Edgar Allan Poe

“Rest and be kind, you don't have to prove anything.” —
Jack Kerouac

“Hope is important because it can make the present moment less difficult to bear. If we believe that tomorrow will be better, we can bear a hardship today.” —
Thich Nhat Hanh

“Being wrong brings the opportunity for growth.” —
Mark Manson

“In all human affairs there are efforts, and there are results, and the strength of the effort is the measure of the result.” —
James Allen

“Anything you may hold firmly in your imagination can be yours.” —
William James

“If I can pay the bills, I'm happy.” —
Morgan Wootten

“Don't set your own goals by what other people make important.” —
Lolly Daskal

“Know the rules well, so you can break them effectively.” —
Dalai Lama

“People who bite the hand that feeds them usually lick the boot that kicks them.” —
Eric Hoffer

“All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.” —
Walt Disney

“Insanity: doing the same thing over and over again and expecting different results.” —
Albert Einstein

“Nothing you do is going to matter that much in the long run. Don't take yourself so seriously.” —
Naval Ravikant

“Nothing is more real than nothing.” —
Samuel Beckett

“Start each day with a positive thought and a grateful heart.” —
Roy T. Bennett

“Unhappiness enters through a door that has been left open.” —
Zen Proverb

“All wealth is the product of labor.” —
John Locke

“Not doing it is certainly the best way to not getting it. ” —
Wayne Gretzky

“When you are talented you do it whatever it is until your fingers bleed or your eyes are ready to fall out of your head.” —
Stephen King

“To acquire true self power you have to feel beneath no one, be immune to criticism and be fearless.” —
Deepak Chopra

“Wisdom is doing now what you are going to be happy with later on.” —
Joyce Meyer

“He who loses wealth loses much; he who loses a friend loses more; but he that loses his courage loses all.” —
Miguel de Cervantes

“From the errors of others, a wise man corrects his own.” —
Publilius Syrus

“We shape clay into a pot, but it is the emptiness inside that holds whatever we want.” —
Lao Tzu

“One must be poor to know the luxury of giving.” —
George Eliot

“You may delay, but time will not.” —
Benjamin Franklin

“When you have to make a choice and don't make it, that is in itself a choice.” —
William James

“To get angry is like to revenge yourself for the guilt of others.” —
Jonathan Swift

“Human beings believe just as they breathe - in order to survive.” —
Carlos Ruiz Zafon

“It all depends on what you choose to believe.” —
Spencer Johnson

“The man who does not value himself, cannot value anything or anyone.” —
Ayn Rand

“In the end, it's not the years in your life that count. It's the life in your years.” —
Abraham Lincoln

“True love stories never have endings.” —
Richard Bach

“It is well known that those who do not trust themselves never trust others.” —
Alfred Adler

“Projecting your mind into a successful situation is the most powerful means to achieve goals. ” —
Estee Lauder

“Don't give up the fight, Stand up for your rights.” —
Bob Marley

“Doing what you love is the cornerstone of having abundance in your life. ” —
Wayne Dyer

“The dead receive more flowers than the living because regret is stronger than gratitude.” —
Anne Frank

“Darkness is the absence of light.” —
Kamal Ravikant

“What we know is a drop, what we don't know is an ocean. ” —
Isaac Newton

“A successful man is one who can lay a firm foundation with the bricks others have thrown at him. ” —
David Brinkley

“Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity. ” —
Seneca

“The only normal people are the ones you don't know very well.” —
Alfred Adler

“If you want to turn a vision into reality, you have to give 100% and never stop believing in your dream.” —
Arnold Schwarzenegger

“The hardest arithmetic to master is that which enables us to count our blessings.” —
Eric Hoffer

“A fear-oriented man is always calculating, planning, arranging, safeguarding. His whole life is lost in this way.” —
Osho

“Remain calm, serene, always in command of yourself. You will then find out how easy it is to get along. ” —
Paramahansa Yogananda

“Life is trying things to see if they work.” —
Ray Bradbury

“I didn't get there by wishing for it or hoping for it, but by working for it.” —
Estee Lauder

“Peace is not the absence of conflict, but the ability to cope with it.” —
Unknown

“I succeeded by saying what everyone else is thinking.” —
Joan Rivers

“You can't build a reputation on what you are going to do. ” —
Henry Ford

“Success is never final; failure is never fatal.” —
Conrad Hilton

“The most difficult times for many of us are the ones we give ourselves.” —
Pema Chodron

“All life is a manifestation of the spirit, the manifestation of love.” —
Morihei Ueshiba

“To lead an orchestra, you must turn your back on the crowd.” —
Aristotle

“Every man is guilty of all the good he did not do. ” —
Voltaire

“What we dwell on is who we become.” —
Oprah Winfrey

“The giving of love is an education in itself.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt
